author: Andreas Spiess
description:
My problem started when I bought this car. As an electronics engineer, I didn’t want to leave this planet without owning an electric vehicle. With its 650 horsepower, it’s a thrill to drive — and with 3.8 seconds from 0 to 100 km/h, or 60 mph, it reminds me of my sporty motorcycle. The car is a Smart #5, BTW. I used OCPP 1.6J and EVCC to solve the problem

My second channel: https://www.youtube.com/HB9BLAWireless

Links:
OCPP: https://openchargealliance.org/protocols/open-charge-point-protocol/
Smart #5: https://uk.smart.com/en/models/hashtag-five/
OCPP Tester: https://github.com/SensorsIot/OCPP-Tester
ESP32 Mini used for Modbus proxy and EV simulator: https://s.click.aliexpress.com/e/_c3IK8EPn
Insulated RS485 (Modbus) interfaces: https://s.click.aliexpress.com/e/_c3iegVA1

Patreon supporter companies:
https://www.welectron.com/

The links above are usually affiliate links that support the channel (at no additional cost to you).
Supporting Material and Blog Page: http://www.sensorsiot
title: How to charge an EV using Solar, OCPP, and EVCC
